intro: Cybianthus steyermarkianus, commonly known as the Steyermark's cybianthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
